course.name: Done is better - Build What Matters

questions.question: A project is at risk but the stakeholder will find out only at the deadline. What is wrong?
options: Surprises destroy trust; share status early: on track, at risk, or blocked

questions.question: In this framework, how is "no surprises" culture defined?
options: Share status early; surface bad news with options or a proposed fix; never hide a miss until the last moment
Never share bad news with anyone
Only share good news and hide risks
Share everything daily regardless of relevance

questions.question: If you are blocked, what should you do?
options: Share status (at risk/blocked) and add one sentence on what you need or what you propose

questions.question: Hoping the problem will go away often leads to:
options: Surprising stakeholders at the deadline and losing trust

questions.question: Surprising stakeholders at the deadline can result in:
options: Loss of trust; they could have helped or adjusted if they had known earlier

questions.question: What should you send for one project as a minimum?
options: A one-line status: on track / at risk / blocked; if at risk or blocked, add what you need or propose

questions.question: Why escalate bad news with a proposed fix?
options: So the recipient can act or align; options reduce anxiety and build trust
